{"step_by_step_thinking": "The curve that passes through the cusps of all the posteriors and reaches the condyle is known as the Curve of Spee. The Curve of Spee is a natural curve that exists in the occlusal plane of the dentition. It is named after the German dentist, Friedrich Wilhelm von Spee, who first described it. The Curve of Spee is important for maintaining proper occlusion and distributing forces evenly during chewing and biting.", "answer_choice": "D. Curve of Spee."}
